what: Background on Item Response Theory, the 1-Parameter Logistic Model, and the PNT-CAT
title: About Item Response Theory
text: adaptive testing algorithm scoring metric versions PNT included application based 1-parameter logistic item response theory (1-PL IRT) model PNT (Fergadiotis et al., 2015). IRT model places items persons common latent trait scale , given calibrated estimates item difficulty person ability, provides predictions expected response item person. Alternatively, given set item difficulty estimates string associated responses individual, 1-PL IRT model provides score estimate associated standard error measurement. Following convention IRT literature, item difficulty person ability estimates application scaled equal, expected response 0.5, meaning 100 individuals ability = 50 administered item difficulty = 50, approximately 50 correct 50 incorrect responses. Likewise, person ability = 50 given 100 items difficulty = 50, expected respond correctly half. person ability increases relative item difficulty, expected score increases 0.5, person ability decreases relative item difficulty, expected score decreases 0.5, reaching asymptote expectation approaches 0 1. Interested readers referred Baylor colleagues (2011) general introduction item response theory speech-language pathologists Alex Swiderski’s Shiny Application provides graphical presentation 1-PL IRT model PNT key concepts IRT. See Fergadiotis, Casilio, Hula, Swiderski (2021) overview research program PNT-CAT testing application based. Initial fitting evaluation 1-PL model PNT frequentest statistical framework reported Fergadiotis, Kellough, Hula (2015), using sample 251 persons aphasia Moss Aphasia Psycholinguistics Project Database (MAPPD; Mirman et al., 2010). Initial development simulation testing PNT-CAT versions using data set MAPPD reported Hula, Kellough, & Fergadiotis (2015). Empirical comparison PNT-CAT30 full PNT reported Fergadiotis, Hula, Swiderski, Lei, Kellough (2019). Empirical comparison PNT-CAT30 PNT-CATVL described Hula, Fergadiotis, Swiderski, Silkes, & Kellough (2020). refitting PNT 1-PL model Bayesian statistical framework, based larger data set MAPPD reported Huston (2021), current item difficulty estimates taken work.

what: Some Advantages of Using IRT in Clinical Assessment
title: IRT in the Clinic
text: One major advantage IRT scaling permits clinicians administer different subsets items different individuals individual different occasions obtain scores scale thus directly comparable. Direct comparison percent correct number correct scores across different tests item subsets possible total number correct linear transformations take account relative difficulty items. example, although total correct score 70 PNT total correct score 24 Boston Naming Test (BNT; Kaplan et al., 2001) correspond 40% correct, reflect level anomia severity BNT items , average difficult items contained PNT. 1-PL IRT model places items persons common scale scores derived scale depend particular items administered, assuming adequate model fit application appropriate clinical population (.e., stroke survivors aphasia). explained , facilitates adaptive testing assessment alternative test forms repeat specific item content thus avoid kinds test practice effects. second advantage IRT modeling provides individualized estimates measurement error associated score estimate, referred standard error standard error measurement. standard error measurement, can used determine extent difference two individual score estimates exceed measurement error thus likely represent real underlying difference. present application, amount measurement error associated given score estimate determined primarily two factors: (1) number items administered (2) degree difficulty administered items targeted ability person tested. things equal, administering items decrease measurement error increase precision score estimate. Regarding item-person targeting, intuitively apparent group persons severe aphasia given test composed entirely easy--name items, ‘cat’, ‘ear’, ‘bed’, ‘hat’, ‘tree’, scores vary meaningfully possible rank order terms number name correctly. hand, group individuals severe aphasia given test composed difficult--name items, ‘microscope’, ‘stethoscope’, ‘pyramid’, ‘binoculars’, ‘volcano’, likely receive minimum score rank ordering terms number correct possible. Conceptually, item difficulty person ability closely matched, predicted response close 0.5, uncertain whether item named correctly, thus observed response provides useful information. item difficulty person ability apart, expected score approaches 0 1, confident prediction whether item named correctly can made, observed response provides correspondingly less new information. interactive graphical presentation relationship participant ability item difficulty predictive probability correct response see https://aswiderski.shinyapps.io/ShinyIRT/. third major advantage IRT modeling can used support computer adaptive test (CAT) administration. primary advantage adaptive testing minimizes loss measurement precision associated shortening test, especially individuals particularly high particularly low ability. current PNT application, CAT provide benefit relative static short form individuals especially mild severe anomia. adaptive versions PNT begin item average difficulty (e.g., ‘pumpkin’) select new item target current naming score estimate based responses collected point.

title: Obstacles to using IRT
text: One obstacle using IRT models clinical assessment relationship responses resulting score estimate complicated number-correct percent-correct scoring. However, many clinical assessments speech-language pathology appropriately rely norm-referenced scores typically constructed scaling number correct scores mean standard deviation relatively large sample population interest. approach available IRT framework well chosen scale score estimates mean 50 standard deviation 10 calibration sample. note, norm-referenced scores often non-linearly transformed approximate normal distribution, done current application, even though distribution scores calibration sample negatively skewed. made choice transformation complicated relationship item difficulty, person ability, expected score predicted response. , users application aware although T-score 50 represents estimated mean score persons aphasia score 60 indicates score one standard deviation mean, scores correspond percentile ranks associated values normal score distribution. However, differences relatively small: T-score 50th percentile (median) calibration sample 51.9, score 60 87th percentile, whereas expected fall 84th percentile scores normally distributed. second obstacle using IRT models clinical assessment rely relatively strong assumptions data nature underlying construct assessed. One assumption items included assessment respond single underlying construct dimension. present context, application 1-PL IRT model requires explicit assumption ability name common objects can represented single dimension, trait, ability. Thus, use present application, matter total score metric naming assessment, ignores well-supported view naming ability aphasia can impaired along multiple dimensions, e.g., semantics, lexical selection, phonology. complicated models required measure abilities expressed along multiple dimensions (e.g., Walker et al., 2018) models challenging apply adaptive testing. use unidimensional model PNT oversimplification reality, useful simplification well established field clinical aphasiology. third obstacle implementation IRT clinical assessment require relatively large amounts data (.e., large study samples) support testing model assumptions, validation model predictions, robust estimation item parameters. Fortunately, Moss Aphasia Psycholinguistics Project Database (Mirman et al., 2010) provided excellent foundation line research led present PNT-CAT application. fourth issue concerns specific limitation current PNT-CAT application. computer adaptive test requires calibrated item bank items can selected administration. current context, item bank set items shown respond single underlying trait ability (.e., unidimensional) located common metric scale. 1-PL IRT model, locating items common scale involves estimating difficulty relative one another sample individuals providing response data, process referred calibration. One issue present PNT-CAT application item bank limited 175 items full PNT. function optimally, CAT requires large number items distributed across full range difficulty. PNT item bank contains relatively large number items lower-middle range difficulty/ability scale (approximately 40 55 T-score scale), somewhat fewer items lower end spectrum 40 can targeted individuals severe anomia items upper end scale can administered individuals mild anomia. Practically, means person severe anomia given PNT-CAT30 responded incorrectly 10 easiest items PNT (e.g., ‘cat’, ‘key’, ‘eye’. ‘bed’, ‘ear’, ‘nose’, ‘baby’, ‘hand’, ‘hat’, ‘tree’), becomes increasingly unlikely get subsequent item correct, new item provides progressively less information. Likewise, person mild aphasia responded correctly 10 hardest items (‘stethoscope’, ‘microscope’, ‘pyramid’, ‘binoculars’, ‘volcano’, ‘ambulance’, ‘dinosaur’, ‘cheerleaders’, ‘thermometer’, ‘slippers’), becomes increasingly likely get subsequent item correct continuing administer additional items provides progressively decreasing information. time, noted persons aphasia commonly experience substantial moment--moment variability naming behavior, unexpected correct incorrect responses can occur rates somewhat greater predicted 1-PL model (Fergadiotis et al., 2015; Huston, 2021). Despite variability, found PNT-CAT30 produces scores highly correlated full PNT (r = 0.95; Fergadiotis, Hula, Swiderski, Lei, Kellough, 2019) agreement PNT-CAT30 PNT-CATVL also high (r = 0.89; Hula, Fergadiotis, Swiderski, Silkes, Kellough, 2019).

what: PNT-30A, PNT-30B: 30-item static short forms A & B (Walker & Schwartz, 2012)

title: pnt: Computer adaptive forms of the Philadelphia Naming Test
text: Users application first familiarize administration scoring procedures PNT (https://mrri.org/philadelphia-naming-test/), focus rules determining first complete attempt identifying correct responses. application uses dichotomous correct/incorrect scoring, can applied online sufficient accuracy trained users. However, rules determining first complete attempt, , lesser extent, correct responses can challenging apply cases, recommend audio recording administrations offline review. Also note, standard PNT administration rules allow examinees 30 seconds respond item, consistent Walker Schwartz (2012), validation studies present PNT-CAT short forms (Fergadiotis et al., 2019; Hula et al., 2020) allowed 10 seconds. Users also review different versions PNT available psychometric properties. can found Article entitled “PNT-Versions” . what: Installation Option 1. Installing the app locally via remotes::install_github()
title: pnt: Computer adaptive forms of the Philadelphia Naming Test
text: Install R (required) RStudio (strongly recommended) guide installing R RStudio can found : https://psyteachr.github.io/reprores-v2/installingr.html. guide “R” refers statistical programming language basic GUI comes R (shown left). RStudio refers application runs R many additional features (shown right).  guide using RStudio can found : https://psyteachr.github.io/reprores-v2/intro.html commands can run copying pasting console hitting enter key. point forward, strongly recommend using RStudio instead R GUI computer university/hospital restrictions installing software, may need request administration rights installation process. ’re unable install R/RStudio, can create RStudio Cloud account (https://rstudio.cloud/) install run acom application . already R installed computer, recommend making sure R-version > 3.6.0. can check R version installed running sessionInfo() console. Enable LaTeX install pandoc (recommended, like app generate PDF performance report) ’re using R/R GUI (Rstudio), ’ll need install rmarkdown (R package) pandoc (install pandoc https://pandoc.org/installing.html) use report function (Rstudio comes pandoc, R/R GUI ). Install LaTeX distribution: TinyTex lightweight LaTeX distribution typically recommended R Rmarkdown (https://bookdown.org/yihui/rmarkdown-cookbook/install-latex.html). Run following console RStudio R GUI. Download PNT package Run following code console RStudio R GUI: asked install packages source binaries, recommended selecting ‘’. asked update packages, recommend selecting yes. Sometimes can cause errors. Please raise issue github (https://github.com/rbcavanaugh/acom/issues) problems downloading app. Copy paste error issue. Run app using built function

text: get error saying “Error loadNamespace(x): package called "rmarkdown'” means need install package. example, following error can resolved running install.packages("rmarkdown") console, re-running rmarkdown::find_pandoc() tinytex::install_tinytex(). Installing rmarkdown works commands, tinytex included install rmarkdown.

what: pnt: Computer adaptive forms of the Philadelphia Naming Test
title: Computer adaptive forms of the Philadelphia Naming Test
text: R package web-app administering Computer Adaptive Philadelphia Naming Test (PNT-CAT). PNT-CAT Technical documentation

title: Computer adaptive forms of the Philadelphia Naming Test
text: application allows clinician users administer adaptive (PNT-CAT) static versions Philadelphia Naming Test (Roach et al., 1996 generate output provides scores common T-score metric, expected mean standard deviation persons aphasia 50 10, respectively. Users option downloading performance data pdf-report results. Please note app store data beyond single user-session. Comments, feedback, bug reports encouraged. Please submit issue: https://github.com/rbcavanaugh/pnt/issues. cite publications use: Cavanaugh, R., Swiderski, .M., Fergadiotis, G. & Hula, W.D. (2020). pnt: Computer adaptive forms Philadelphia Naming Test. Version 0.1.0 Available https://github.com/rbcavanaugh/pnt. users looking deeper dive principles item-response theory computer adaptive testing aphasia, recommend: Fergadiotis, Casilio, Hula, Swiderski, 2021 https://aswiderski.shinyapps.io/IRTapp/

title: Computer adaptive forms of the Philadelphia Naming Test
text: development testing application funded National Institute Deafness Communication Disorders Awards R03DC014556 (PI: Fergadiotis) R01DC018813 (MPIs: Fergadiotis & Hula), VA Rehabilitation Research & Development Career Development Award C7476W (PI: Hula), VA Pittsburgh Healthcare System Geriatric Research, Education, Clinical Center. also like acknowledge support assistance Myrna Schwartz, Dan Mirman, Adelyn Brecher, Erica Middleton, Patrick Doyle, Malcolm McNeil, Christine Matthews, Angela Grzybowski, Brooke Swoyer, Maria Fenner, Michelle Gravier, Alyssa Autenreith, Emily Boss, Haley Dresang, Lauren Weerts, Hattie Olson, Kasey Graue, Chia-Ming Lei, Joann Silkes, Diane Kendall, staff VA Pittsburgh Healthcare System Audiology Speech Pathology Program.

title: Computer adaptive forms of the Philadelphia Naming Test
text: number ways use application (see ). However, please note server resources finite, therefore ask researchers use option 2 following reasons: (1) version app remains consistent throughout research study (option 1, 3, 4 may change based updates app), (2) inactive time-limitation free online version app keep server costs reasonable, means long break (>15 minutes) without activity may cause lose current session. (3) free online version shiny::runGithub() function require stable internet connection data lost internet connection lost. Detailed installation instructions can found : https://github.com/rbcavanaugh/pnt/wiki

title: Run the Shiny Application — run_app
text: onStart function called app actually run. needed shinyAppObj, since shinyAppDir case, global.R file can used purpose. options Named options passed runApp call (can following: "port", "launch.browser", "host", "quiet", "display.mode" "test.mode"). can also specify width height parameters provide hint embedding environment ideal height/width app. enableBookmarking Can one "url", "server", "disable". default value, NULL, respect setting previous calls  enableBookmarking(). See enableBookmarking() information bookmarking app. uiPattern regular expression applied GET request determine whether ui used handle request. Note entire request path must match regular expression order match considered successful. ... arguments pass golem_opts.  See `?golem::get_golem_options` details.
